CatDescriptText: Mr. Earlest Peoples, 831 Francis Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 15, 1958, pg. 2 �Do you think that the numbers game should be legalized or outlawed?� answer reads: �I look on the question this way. If the numbers were legalized, it would make it a lot easier on the working man.  People, therefore, would not have to sneak around to play the numbers.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Earlest Peoples, wearing moustache, light colored leather zippered jacket with pockets and ribbed waist, and cap, standing on corner of Liberty Avenue and Sixth Avenue, across the street from Woolworth with striped awnings, pedestrians in background
